intro: Trymalium leucophractum, commonly known as the white-fringed trymalium, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in heathlands and open woodlands. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
